tests.description: Enterprise software vendor addressing financial services client concerns

inputPayload.mainObjections: The client's concerns include: 1) Will their data be used to train your AI models? 2) How do you comply with banking regulations (OCC guidance on AI)? 3) What happens during an AI system failure? 4) How do you ensure AI outputs are accurate for financial decisions? 5) Their board is asking about AI risk management. 6) Concerns about vendor lock-in with AI features.
inputPayload.yourAICapabilities: Our platform uses AI for: document analysis and extraction (contract review, statement parsing), intelligent search across their document repository, automated report generation with natural language summaries, anomaly detection in transaction data, predictive analytics for customer behavior. We use GPT-4 via Azure OpenAI and custom-trained models.
inputPayload.dataHandlingPractices: Customer data is processed in their dedicated Azure tenant. Data is encrypted at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3). We do NOT use customer data for model training - only for inference. Azure OpenAI does not retain prompts or outputs. Our custom models are trained only on synthetic and licensed data. We maintain complete audit logs of all AI operations.
inputPayload.complianceCertifications: SOC2 Type II (annual), ISO 27001 certified, SOC1 Type II for financial controls, GDPR compliant (EU operations), Undergoing FedRAMP Moderate authorization.

criteria.description: Executive summary is clear for non-technical leadership
Technical details are accurate and specific
Provides clear path forward for engagement

tests.description: Addressing very skeptical healthcare client with many objections

inputPayload.mainObjections: This client has raised extensive concerns: 1) HIPAA compliance - how do you ensure PHI never reaches AI systems? 2) Patient safety - what if AI gives wrong clinical guidance? 3) Liability - who is responsible for AI errors? 4) They heard about AI hallucinations and don't trust any AI. 5) Their legal team wants to understand exactly how the AI works. 6) Bias concerns - could AI discriminate against certain patient populations? 7) Transparency - can providers explain AI recommendations to patients? 8) They want the option to opt-out of AI entirely.
inputPayload.yourAICapabilities: Our healthcare platform uses AI for: clinical documentation assistance (not clinical decisions), administrative workflow automation, appointment scheduling optimization, patient communication drafting (human review required), billing code suggestions (human approval required). We explicitly do NOT make clinical diagnoses or treatment recommendations.
inputPayload.dataHandlingPractices: PHI is processed in HIPAA-compliant environment only. BAA available and required. AI features can be completely disabled per customer. All AI suggestions require human approval before any patient impact. We maintain detailed logs for compliance audits. De-identification applied before any analytics.
inputPayload.complianceCertifications: HITRUST CSF certified, SOC2 Type II, HIPAA compliant with BAA, Annual third-party security assessments.

tests.description: Progressive technology client wanting to understand AI capabilities

inputPayload.mainObjections: This client is AI-savvy but has specific technical questions: 1) What models do you use and can we fine-tune them? 2) What's your prompt injection protection strategy? 3) How do you handle model updates and version control? 4) Can we get access to evaluation metrics and benchmarks? 5) What's the latency and throughput of AI features? 6) Do you offer private model deployments?
inputPayload.yourAICapabilities: We offer advanced AI capabilities: multiple model options (GPT-4, Claude, custom fine-tuned), RAG with vector search for knowledge bases, real-time streaming responses, batch processing for large datasets, A/B testing framework for AI features, custom model training on customer data (optional, isolated environment), API access for integration.
inputPayload.dataHandlingPractices: Multiple deployment options: shared multi-tenant (data isolated), dedicated tenant (customer's cloud), on-premise deployment (enterprise plan). All options include encryption, access controls, and audit logging. Customer choice on data retention. Option to use customer's own Azure OpenAI or AWS Bedrock.
inputPayload.complianceCertifications: SOC2 Type II, ISO 27001, GDPR compliant, Privacy Shield certified.

criteria.description: Appropriate technical depth for sophisticated audience
Positions as technical partner, not just vendor
Offers technical deep-dive and POC options
